intro: Athanasia quinquedentata, commonly known as the five-toothed everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, tightly packed flowers that resemble a cluster of tiny stars, typically blooming in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is well adapted to dry conditions, storing water in its succulent stems and leaves. Athanasia quinquedentata is often used in rock gardens and as a ornamental plant due to its resilience and aesthetic appeal.
